alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 4:32AM CDT until May 24 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHERN HANCOCK COUNTY AND SOUTHERN ST. TAMMANY PARISH... At 432 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen in portions of the warned area. Radar imagery indicates more areas of training heavy rain possible leading to additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... New Orleans, Slidell, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Stennis Space Center, Pearlington, Lacombe, Kiln, Shoreline Park and Slidell Airport. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 12 between mile markers 63 and 84. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 10. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
